title: Drawing, "Textile Design:  Montezuma", 1910–12
medium: Brush and gouache, pen and black ink, graphite on paper
markings: Stamp:  lower right corner of mount:  WIENER/ WERKSTÄTTE in red
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink  lower center of mount:  DESSIN:  MONTE - ZVMA; inscribed in pen and blue ink, top right corner: 130.
dimensions:
5.7 x 20.3 cm (2 1/4 x 8 in.)
31.8 x 45.1 cm (12 1/2 x 17 3/4 in.); complete sheet
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds
description: The "Montezuma" design consists of rhythmic geometric shapes in the form of alternating curving bands and plant vine in black.  The negative space is filled with color, orange in this design.

exhibitions.title: Glass of the Avant-Garde: From Vienna Secession to Bauhaus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Textile Design:  Montezuma", 1910–12.
1910–12. Brush and gouache, pen and black ink, graphite on paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds. 1988-62-199.
